Package de.psi.efload.packerapi

API for the packing component of the EfficientLoad project.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ContainerType Defines the geometrical properties of a cuboidal container for packages The container spans a three dimensional coordinate system.
IncrementalPacker Defines the interface of a packing algorithm that constructs a sequence of loading plans by adding loading and unloading events incrementally.
IntegralPacker Defines the interface of a packing algorithm that constructs a loading plan for a complete tour.
LoadingPlan Represents the geometrical arrangement of packages within a container together with some key figures.
Package Describes a single unit of a transport which is located whithin a container.
PackageSet Defines a number of packages of the same type.
PackageType Describes the type of a cuboidal package which is to be loaded into a container.
PackerFactory Creates integral and incremental packers implementing the packing algorithms for the EfficientLoad project.
RouteSectionKeyFigures Some key figures for the loading plan on a single route section.
Stack Describes a stack, which holds an amount of packages.
TourTransport An order to transport the specified number of packages of the specified type from one location to another.
 

Class Summary
LoadingResult The result of the packing procedure.
 

Enum Summary
Orientation The orientation of a package relative to its container.
 

Package de.psi.efload.packerapi Description

API for the packing component of the EfficientLoad project.

Package Specification

Outline

This package defines the interface to a packing component. The packing component is that part of a tour planning system (TMS) which is responsible for the allocation of packages in containers.

The API is based on the following model:

  • Rectangular packages are allocated in a rectangular container.
  • The container defines a cartesian coordinate system where x corresponds to its length, y to its width, and z to its height.
  • The algorithm which allocates the packages and thereby creates the loading plan is implemented by a packer.
    • The integral packer creates a single loading plan for a complete tour.
    • The incremental packer creates a sequence of loading plans by adding loading and unloading events incrementally.
  • The loading plan contains the allocated packages and some key figures for each tour segment.
  • The number and types of the packages which are to be loaded at a specified location and unloaded at another location are represented by a tour transport.
  • The dimensions, weight and stacking restrictions of a package are defined by a package type. Packages may be put on a stack only if their load bearing capacity is not execeeded and if they belong to the same stacking group. A stacking group is represented by a unique number.
  • A Location is represented by a zero based index that defines its position within a tour.

Object Instantiation

The caller of the packing component instantiates objects of the following types:

  • ContainerType
  • PackageType
  • TourTransport

The other types of this package are instantiated inside of the packing component.
